channel.title: Anybody else feel that?
channel.description: So a 6.0 earthquake just hit the Washington DC area, and I was able to feel it here in New Jersey. My sisters friend in NC felt it, so I'm wondering if anybody else felt it? That was my first earthquake, and feeling this far away is nuts.

item.title: Anybody else feel that?
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

I don’t know about that,[quote=“Saphire`, post:28, topic:411742”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=512996.msg3723788#msg3723788 date=1314133242]
Here in Belgium, it is raining like shit, it storms almost every night, last time there got 150 people injured and 5 people killed on a concert, the roof collapsed, I mean, it was like really hot and sunny, 30 minutes storm, people dead, really hot and sunny again.

Global warming is starting to leave traces.
[/quote]
Global warming doesn’t exsist anymore, scientists have discovered that the planet fixed itself, so their theory now is that every few thousand years the earth will go warmer than average.

Ill try find the link on NASA, such a big site of information could take a while.[/quote]I believe that is false, I’ve seen a documentary recently about global warming and it was quite conviencing, also just checked the wiki about it and I didn’t find anything stated that it has been prooven wrong.

Another thing, never believe what NASA says, NASA wants people to calm the fuck down and avoid chaos, wich leads to false information until the moment they can’t keep the secrets anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Anybody else feel that?

[quote=“Saphire`, post:28, topic:411742”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=512996.msg3723788#msg3723788 date=1314133242]
Here in Belgium, it is raining like shit, it storms almost every night, last time there got 150 people injured and 5 people killed on a concert, the roof collapsed, I mean, it was like really hot and sunny, 30 minutes storm, people dead, really hot and sunny again.

Global warming is starting to leave traces.
[/quote]
Global warming doesn’t exsist anymore, scientists have discovered that the planet fixed itself, so their theory now is that every few thousand years the earth will go warmer than average.

Ill try find the link on NASA, such a big site of information could take a while.[/quote]

Hooray for happy endings

Read full topic

item.title: Anybody else feel that?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:25, topic:411742”][quote author=EMINEM BEAST™ link=topic=512996.msg3723637#msg3723637 date=1314124868]
Yeah, I live in PA and my whole room was shaking, it freaked the poop outta me… This was the first earthquake I’ve ever experience.

It was a 5.9 though.

http://earthquake.usgs.gov/earthquakes/recenteqsww/Quakes/usc0005ild.php
[/quote]

Just to point out it says 5.8.

My sister and mom said they felt it. New Hampshire.[/quote]
Different sources are saying different things, I’ve seen between 5.6 and 6.

Read full topic

item.title: Anybody else feel that?
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

ds.iris.edu

Seismic Monitor. A colorful, interactive map of the latest earthquakes and much...

Up-to-date map of the latest earthquakes with resources like news, lists, tools and a 3D viewer.

It was on the news today that there was a very small one in my local area (Detroit) and people nearby it could feel it. I almost found it funny when I heard that and came on moparscape and people are like amg earthquakes.
